channel.title: Unreal 1
channel.description:
Hi, I have a Problem with Unreal 1. It crashes when I want to start it in OpenGL mode, I think it has problems with OpenGL 3 but I don't know how to emulate OGL 2 to get it to work. Do someone know a programm which emulates OGL2? I want to use OGL because with D3D the Menu is invisible.
OS/Driver: Geforce 185.81 with OGL 3 and DX10 Windows 7 BETA

item.title: Unreal 1
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
thx, works now!

Read full topic

item.title: Unreal 1
item.dc:creator: popsUlfr
item.description:
I suggest you get the Official version 226Final here: https://liandri.beyondunreal.com/Unreal#Official_PC

And I recommend the Unofficial 227 Patch. It adds some fixes and updated renderers: https://www.oldunreal.com/oldunrealpatches.html
Latest is 227f.

EDIT:
Da fällt mir gerad’ ein, dass ich hunger auf Pfannkuchen habe :rabies:

Read full topic

item.title: Unreal 1
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
yeah and there is the problem.
I set it to “OpenGL support” and restart it but it don’t want to restart, only the standard error window from Windows appears.

Read full topic

item.title: Unreal 1
item.dc:creator: popsUlfr
item.description:
pfannkuchen_ges:

Hi, I have a Problem with Unreal 1.
It crashes when I want to start it in OpenGL mode, I think it has problems with OpenGL 3 but I don’t know how to emulate OGL 2 to get it to work.
Do someone know a programm which emulates OGL2?
I want to use OGL because with D3D the Menu is invisible.

OS/Driver:
Geforce 185.81 with OGL 3 and DX10
Windows 7 BETA

I suppose you used the ‘Old Unreal Multimedia Patch’ ?

[Because normally OpenGL wouldn’t be available in the Original version.] <- No I’m wrong OpenGL support is already there. If you don’t have already I would suggest the patch I mentioned it installs a newer OpenGL driver.

I think the unofficial Patch 227e doesn’t let you play the expansio if you have the GOLD version.

I had the Problem too I remember and I’m not exactly sure how I solved it.

EDIT:
Start the Game again in D3D Mode. Open the console by pressing TAB and type in ‘preferences’. A panel shows up. Extend ‘Drivers’ and in ‘GameRenderDevice’ choose OpenGL. Close the game and restart.

Read full topic
